Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Ava Kim. This is my first time here.
Hello, Ava! It's great to meet you. How are you feeling today?
I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed to be honest. I just started the semester.
That's completely understandable. Starting a new semester can be a lot to handle. What's been on your mind?
After going through the syllabus, I see I have so many projects and deadlines coming up. It's kind of scary.
It can be intimidating to look at a full schedule like that. Have you been able to share your feelings with anyone?
I talked to my mom about it, but I still feel a lot of pressure. I want to perform well and keep my scholarship.
It's commendable to have high aspirations, but it's also important to balance those expectations. What do you think would help ease your stress?
Hi again. I'm struggling to keep up with my workload and it's affecting my confidence.
Welcome back, Ava! I appreciate you coming in. Can you tell me more about what's been difficult for you?
In group projects, I'm hesitant to share my ideas. I feel like I don't measure up to my classmates, especially Lisa who is very assertive.
It's tough to feel overshadowed like that. Have you thought about how you could communicate your ideas more assertively?
I haven't really. It's hard to find the courage when I feel so insecure.
It's completely normal to feel that way, but you have valuable insights to share. Perhaps you can prepare your thoughts ahead of meetings to build your confidence.
That could help. I just worry they won't find my ideas important.
Hey, I'm back again. I've been feeling really lonely lately.
Hi Ava. I'm glad you returned. Can you share what's causing you to feel that way?
As midterms approach, I feel overwhelmed with work. I've been declining invites to hang out and now I worry I'm missing out.
It's understandable to want to focus on your studies, but social connections are also important. How did you feel when you turned down your brother's invitation?
I feel guilty, especially since he looks up to me. I want to be there for him like he's been for me.
Family relationships can be difficult during stressful times. It's okay to be honest with him about your struggles. Have you considered talking to him about how you're feeling?
I've thought about it, but I fear it will worry him more.
Hi! I finally spoke with my advisor, and it felt really good.
That's fantastic to hear, Ava! What came up in your conversation?
I shared my feelings of inadequacy and my struggles in group settings. They provided advice that really resonated with me.
That's a great step forward! What did you find particularly helpful?
They encouraged me to embrace my creativity without fear of judgment and to find little ways to express my ideas confidently.
That sounds empowering! How do you feel about approaching your classes and your peers now?
I feel more hopeful and motivated. I think I can learn to express myself better moving forward.
That's wonderful to hear! Remember, it's a process, and you're not alone in this. Keep nurturing that creativity, and reach out whenever you need support.
